reviews.text: Amazing food & great service!
This place is inedible. Remarkable that people come here. Noodles are cooked to random times usually resembling wire shards.
Excellent food and service, but they played AI music. Spotify Premium ads sounded better than the slop music lmao
Delicious. Give it a try. Wife has been here several times. My first.
The broth is tasteless â€” even instant ramen tastes better than this.

nice little corner restaurant. excellent service and very attentative waitress who served us. the food was descent, ordeered same ramen twice first one was salty and second one was bland. it was weird but taste and texture was ok.
Great service, and the food is incredible! ğŸ‘Œ

Nice ramen shop in the area, 2nd location with first locate on 14 & 8th? Much more traditional and better than the branch of michelin rated ramen shop closer to dumbo that closed down. Trypical menu selection got Takoyaki and Tonkotsu. Pleasant wait staff and cozy place, nice spot to grab a bite after hanging out at brooklyn bridge piers.

In a cute but restaurant-light neighborhood, where most local options are brunch-heavy or bakeries, Kogane is a gem. Small spot, adorned by wood walls and benches, super close to subway, with great food and service. Seaweed salad & Spicy Miso Ramen were both great and staff was attentive. Menu has a ton of options (from ramen to kid-friendly favorites like fries & wings), including many beers & sakes. High chairs available for the little ones. Priced for enjoyment without regret. Will definitely be back!
Noodle is super hard, tastes like undercooked. Theres nothing special about the flavor. The eggâ€™s temperature tastes like itâ€™s straight outta the fridge. Overall bad food.
Super nice place. Fast tasty
Excelent Ramen!

Sehr gutes Essen. Die Bedienung war sehr herzlich. Klein aber absolut empfehlenswert.
Danke fÃ¼r das gute Essen Esther ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­
Very calm, great and warm service. The food tasted very good and the accommodation and at atmosphere was lovely. Would definitely come again!
My baby spilled ramen on himself and the staff rushed to help us. They were wonderful and the food was great as well
Tasty Ramen!
The ramen was the worstâ€”We couldnâ€™t eat it. It had no flavor at all; it was like eating plain water. However,  kimchi with rice was eatable.
O Ramen Ã© muito bom, muito saboroso e o spider bum tambÃ©m adoro!

We stumbled upon Kogane in Brooklyn Heights a few years ago and their delicious ramen has made us repeat customers.  Service is always friendly and expedient and the ramen is mind-blowing.  If youâ€™re ever in the area and craving a warm ramen on a cold day to lift your mood, make it a point to stop by Kogane.
TrÃ¨s belle dÃ©couverte ce restaurant! Cuisine excellente, service tres attentionnÃ© et prix raisonnables. Beaucoup d'habituÃ©s prennent Ã  emporter car la salle est petite, mais agrÃ©ableğŸ‘
The portions are very small The ramen is not tasty and the ramen noodles are not cooked I do not recommend!
I like the sweet potato fries so much. It's crunchy and sweet, a bit oily for me, but still fine. The sauce for the fries are also great. works pretty good with the fries let it taste not that oily.

I had looked up restaurants on TikTok and they popped up and when I say, I scroll through the comments so fast to see what people recommended. I kept seeing them talking about the garlic Ramen. That food was 10 out of 10 it was amazing and the drinks were so good and strong. When I come back to Brooklyn, I will come here again!

Delicious food and very attentive service. Very cool atmosphere inside, very kind server was very helpful. Ramen was very flavorful and delicious. Will definitely stop back in again next time I am in town!
Food was great (spicy miso ramen)
The only good thing I had was the pork buns. Everything else its mid.
The spicy miso ramen is amazing every time, highly recommend.
Nice and cozy neighborhood ramen that delivers bold and big flavors. The spicy miso broth definitely hits the perfect comfort spot on a cold rainy day.
it was very tasty

Really good ramen! Itâ€™s slightly too fatty and oily but a solid 8/10. The fried chicken was a bit disappointing, size of the meat wasnâ€™t at a good ratio. The eggplant was really good, nice miso dressing. The Spider Crab Buns was a nice surprise, good crunch to go with the soft bun. Overall, solid!
Flavorful ramen broth, chewy noodles, accommodating staff.
Cute little ramen spot. We got the tonkotsu ramen and the broth was very flavorful and the park slices were delicious. Fast and attentive service. Perfect for a cold day.

Everybody is so kind and I used to like this place but today I ordered the lobster ramen and the lobster was rotten, it was really hard to notice because the consistency and aspect was good. They changed my dish thoug. I was confused, I liked the broth but I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll ever go back againğŸ¥¹
Noodles were really undercooked, green tea was bad
Great ramen, place, and servers!

Last Saturday I was at your place the food was regular but I don't agree that they add more money to the tip in my case they raised me $10 dollars more on top of the $20 dollars I tipped on the receipt I ended up paying $30 dollars only in tip it's definitely an abuse.

Kogane clearly states on their menu that allergies would be accommodated, however, when we ordered, I specifically noted my allergies and was told that they would not accommodated my allergies. This is the last time we will ever visit this rude establishment.
My husband and I came to NY for our one year anniversary , we are from Texas, and we happened to stumble across this place after walking the brooklyn bridge, most tasteful ramen we have ever had! ğŸ˜
Great food and service! Homemade fresh ramen! I love how the servers are attentive yet donâ€™t avoid approaching the table to ask if everything is good. No interruptions! :)
Miso eggplant so yummy!
great atmosphere and awesome service! delicious food!
Favorite ramen spot !

Saw this spot while walking down to the waterfront. Looked like a nice, quiet, and comfy spot to have a bowl of ramen on a chilly day. So glad I came. I got the Truffle Ramen based on a recommendation from the host. I also ordered Karagge. The ramen hit the spot. The broth was creamy, the chicken was soft, and the noodles were firm. The Karagge was piping hot. Definitely recommend if youâ€™re in the mood for something that will warm you from the inside out!
I come here frequently for the vegetable Gyoza and the vegetarian Ramen! Very friendly staff and delicious food ğŸ¤—
Authentic. Delicious. Will come back every time

Iâ€™ve been eating here consistently for years even prepandemic. Itâ€™s so delious itâ€™s my favorite ramen place in nyc. Itâ€™s a cozy environment with delicious food. I recommend this place for anyone in the area
Cute ramen shop
This is my go to place when I'm craving ramen and come here a couple times a month. I'm vegetarian and both their vegetarian ramen options are great!

Happy to find this little gem in BK heights. The tonkotsu and the kimchi ramen are delicious and definitely well executed. I recommend Kogane for sure.

Good Ramen Point in brooklyn. Cozy and comfort small ramen place. But, meat sould be cook little more.

The best!!! Loved everything about this place, from the hole in the wall vibe to the excellent service to every bite exceeding my expectations. The octopus balls are a must (just trust me!). The kimchi ramen is a dupe for a favorite Iâ€™ve had before and I loved every spoonful of that amazing broth. This will become a regular spot for sure. Also love that they have a small selection of wines and sake but also the regular sodas. Absolutely delicious, could not recommend more!

While this location is more accessible compared to the Manhattan location it's smaller. The White Truffle Ramen had good noodles but I was expecting a more potent truffle flavor. Overall it's still a nice place to get ramen.

Went to Kogane for lunch, and we enjoyed it. The service was quick, and the staff was friendly and attentive. We enjoyed our bowls, and the portions were just right.

Would like to visit again when we are in the neighborhood.

This place was amazing.  We ordered the vegetable dumplings and some ramen. I got the Shoyu Ramen and my husband had the Yaki Ramen.  The Yaki Ramen was very tasty.  The portions are great in size.  The atmosphere was very laid back.  Will definitely come back again.

Got it to go on a Wednesday around 1 pm, ordered through seamless, and pick up was ready by 15 min after placing the order. Perhaps even earlier (it was ready for pickup before the app even said it was ready). Fast service, good food. Wouldâ€¦

A small, charming restaurant (and not noisy), with few tables but very welcoming.
Attentive service.
Tasty Tally dishes, exquisite gyoza.
And above all, the ramen is truly delicious.

Love Kogane, have been going to this and the Manhattan location for a while now. I always try to bring friends when weâ€™re nearby since thereâ€™s something I love about the recipes here. The sazÃ³n is tasty.

Had the takoyaki which is always good and tried the  yuzu ramen for the first time. Super yummy. The yuzu ramen was very citrusy which I loved; just wish it also tasted a bit more like tonkotsu. The texture and mouthfeel of the hand pulled noodles are why I keep coming back.

Def recommend.

Kogane has become one of my favorite places, most recently.
The food is great, as is the service.
Noodle are fresh and cooked to perfection.
Music choice is ok, definitely not a great fit with the food and the atmosphere of the place, but since food is great, I can forgive them for making me listen to â€œThe Weekndâ€, while Iâ€™m having ramen.

They were able to seat me at 9pm on a Friday night & I was served within 5 minutes which was great. I had the spicy miso ramen which was pretty good, although the noodles arenâ€™t my favorite. So perhaps personal preference. I would come back but I wouldnâ€™t go out of my way.

a nice ramen restaurant! we went right around 12:30 on a Saturday, no wait. was seated very quickly, service gave us green tea and water right away :). we ordered spicy tonkatsu and regular tonkatsu ramen - it was so tasty, and loved theâ€¦

I would give this place 10 stars if I could everything from service, flavors and ambiance was perfect. If you like Ramen this is heaven.
They have a burger that instead of a bun they have cooked noodles, simplyâ€¦

The service was terrible here. I came but the lady kept ignoring me until I signaled her for a table. Then when I was about to tell her what my order was, she ignored me again and turned to other customers. How rude that was??? Plus the dining area was unpleasant too â€” i kept seeing flies where I was sitting. The food wasnâ€™t great either. Look at this noodles in the photo. Theyâ€™re still hard and stuck together â€” and is this what they call â€œfresh ramenâ€? Would not come back here again. The high rating was prolly from white people who have no standards for ramen and good customer service.

Great Ramen! I had the pork ramen bowl. The bowls are very big and the pork gyoza was cooked perfectly with the sauce. The green tea was refreshing. My only qualm is the staff member who served us, never asked if my friend and I were ok and was staring at us a little too often for me. Maybe she was just checking on us with her eyesğŸ¤·ğŸ¾â€â™€ï¸ thatâ€™s the only reason itâ€™s not 5 stars.. but overall Iâ€™ll definitely be back.

Good quality ramen for a decent price!  I've been here twice already and the ramen broth is the right amount of thickness and the noodles aren't overcooked.  The pork belly was delicious and tender.  Their egg was amazing and just cooked right where it is runny when you cut into it.

I like the vibe here, the Tonkotsu broth is so flavorful and rich, the black garlic oil is an amazing add on.
The noodle itself is kind of too hard for me, I normally donâ€™t specifically askâ€¦

On Friday July 21, 2023 @ 12:30PM the Female server with black hair with no glasses was forcefully grabbing the to-go bag from me when I requested to sit so I can also order dessert . The female server was NOT pleasant. The serve did NOT listen to what I had to say . She kept talking over me . I wouldn't recommend coming if this server is here
The cook was very good and did a very good job

Kogane is a ramen restaurant located in Brooklyn just right of the Brooklyn Bridge. It has both exterior and interior seating. Their menu isn't all that large, but that is in their favor as they, by my opinion, seem to have mastery of the deslicate art that is ramen. My first time their I took on the Red Tonkotsu Ramen, a nice creamy but heavy ramen that took on a greater level of flavor once chilli paste is added. The heat was perfect. The virtually impossible balancing act that all the ingredients take while swimming in the broth was beautifully done to such a magnificent display that most every other ramen place I have visited before has been lost to the shadow of my memory.

If I could name one negitive it would be the seating. This is probably towards persons who only share my physical issues. The indoor seats that face in foot traffic have no back support. If you can hold yourself up for to long don't sick on that side. Other then that, this place rocks.

They have great service and their broth is so flavorful. I had their spicy vegetarian ramen and their Kogane wings which were cooked crispy just how I prefer. AND THE SAUCE ot comes with is delicious. Their service is so nice too, the staff was very attentive. Definitely coming here again

Some of the best ramen Iâ€™ve ever had. The noodle is the right hardness that softens perfectly in the broth. I had the tonkutsu and it was really nice and salty while my friend had the Yuzu and it had a nice citrus flavour that didnâ€™t over power the rest of the broth. Definitely recommend.

Gyoza is amazing
Ramen is soso
Lobster Ramen provided 1/4 - 1/5 lobster in the ramen. You have to be lucky to get the edible place

(Frist time dinning at Kogane) Went here with my mom and aunt for my mom's birthday and was not disappointed! We arrived yesterday [26th, Friday] around 4:30pm and it was empty(yay). Our appetizers were Vegetable and Pork gyoza(my mom and aunt don't eat pork) it was delicious and well prepared. For ramen we had 2 Shoyu and 1 Tonkotsu and once again, it was delicious. Though it was my aunt's first time having ramen and she struggled with those chopsticks ğŸ˜… she loved it.

The staff was polite and attentive to us. The food was great and they wait time for it was less than 15mins. The atmosphere was calm and pretty well organized when it comes to space- they also have outdoor seating. Given the time that we went, we were lucky and after about an hour more people started come.

I havenâ€™t had too many ramen spots here in NYC but this one had very very delicious ramen. The tonkatsu pork broth was delectable and the noodles were so springy and scrumptious. The only downside is that they didnâ€™t use the traditional chashu pork belly slices but it was amazing nonetheless!
This is one of our favorite ramen ğŸœ place in Brooklyn! We have to order takoyaki every time cuz itâ€™s so delicious!

Definitely one of the better ramen places in Brooklyn. The wait for this place can get long so make sure you get there early or on off peak hours. The broth for all the ramens were very rich and steaming hot when they came out of the kitchen, perfect in my opinion. Will come back again to try some other dishes.
The noodles were a bit undercooked sadly for both me and my partner. We both ordered the tonkatsu ramen and karaage. The karaage was good though especially with the spicy mayo.

Altogether a 4/5 star place. Second time eating here. Takoyaki and ramen are good, though the chashu is of very poor quality.

The takoyaki is impeccable, with the right amount of filling to batter ratio. Batter was fried to perfection, too, with a crisp skin. The octopus was also flavorful.

For the ramen, the broth is amazing - very thick, fragrant and flavorful. The noodles are also perfectly cooked to the perfect texture. The bowl of tonkotsu ramen came with a generous helping of spring onions, bamboo shoots, half a ramen egg and chashu.

This would be the perfect bowl of ramen for me, if not for the disappointing chashu, which had a rubbery texture and was lacking in flavor.

Would definitely be back, but would not get the chashu again.
Chill here 1 times a week. Great ramen place in the area the taste is almost same as the local cuisine in Japan. They put a lot of meat than before so kudos to that. Check it out.
Very clean and relaxing environment to grab a bite to eat. The Ramen burger was over cooked and dry though. Flavor was great, so it wasn't a complete disaster.

Me and my siblings have been coming here for quite some time. Itâ€™s the lace we look foward to each winter. I LOVE coming here for ramen ğŸœ The service is great ! And the food ğŸ‘ï¸ğŸ«¦ğŸ‘ï¸ delicious ğŸ¤¤

Not what I expected at all. Ramen enthusiast stopping into Brooklyn just for the night. Had to have my fix.

Got the spicy miso, gyoza, and Wings (Togo). Ramen wasnâ€™t overly thick or spicy. Perfect balance. Pork was savory and not overly fatty. Gyoza was crispy but still tender.

Service was impeccable. Water stayed topped up on a hot day. Was even given green tea after finishing my meal.

Worth a try if you havenâ€™t been!!

a tasty bowl of ramen on a cold rainy night! the broth was mostly just salty, but the noodles were fresh and delicious. chashu was okay. we also got the shishito peppers, which defied all expectations by being incredibly spicy â€” iâ€™m not sure if this is a pro or a con. eat at your own risk.

they were busy but not crowded on a monday night; staff were friendly and polite. iâ€™d come back if i happened to be in the area, but probably wouldnâ€™t go out of my way to eat here again.
